com.percussion.design.objectstore
Class PSRole

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponent
      com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRole
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSComponent, IPSDatabaseComponent, IPSCatalogIdentifier, IPSCatalogSummary, Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable
public class PSRole
extends PSDatabaseComponent
implements Comparable, IPSCatalogSummary

The PSRole class provides a way to group users within E2. Roles can be used within ACLs to grant a specific type of access to all members of the role.

Roles are named collections containing PSRelativeSubject objects, and as such are derived from the PSDatabaseComponentCollection class. Simply use the methods defined in PSDatabaseComponentCollection to gain access to the PSSubject objects defined for the role.

See Also:
PSApplication.getRoles(), PSRelativeSubject, PSCollectionComponent, Serialized Form

toDatabaseXml

public void toDatabaseXml(Document doc,
                          Element actionRoot,
                          com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation relationContext)
                   throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
This method is called to create one or more Action XML elements containing the data described in this object that is used to update the database. The Elements are appended to the root of the passed in doc. This method then calls the toDatabaseXml method on any of this object's children.

The structure of the XML element(s) appended to the document (using a root element called 'root') is: 


 <!ELEMENT root (Action*)>
 <!ELEMENT Action (PSXAttribute)
 <!ATTLIST Action
 type (INSERT | UPDATE | DELETE | UNKNOWN) #REQUIRED
 >
 <!ELEMENT PSXRole (name)>
 <!ATTLIST PSXRole
    id CDATA #REQUIRED
    DbComponentId CDATA #REQUIRED
 >

 <!--
    the name of the role. This must be unique within the application.
    This is limited to 50 characters.
 -->
 <!ELEMENT name          (#PCDATA)>

Specified by:
toDatabaseXml in interface IPSDatabaseComponent
Overrides:
toDatabaseXml in class PSDatabaseComponent
Parameters:
doc - The database modification document being created. May not be null.
actionRoot - The root element under which all DBMS actions (updates, inserts, and deletes) are to be added. May not be null or empty.
relationContext - Any relationship context information, so that new relationships may be added to the back end as needed by the components which require them. May be null indicating there is no relationship existing for this component.
Throws:
PSDatabaseComponentException - if there are errors creating the element.
See Also:
PSDatabaseComponent.toDatabaseXml(org.w3c.dom.Document, org.w3c.dom.Element, com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation), PSDatabaseComponentCollection.toDatabaseXml(org.w3c.dom.Document, org.w3c.dom.Element, com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation)

                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.server.PSDatabaseComponentLoader cl,
                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation relationContext)
                     throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException,
                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
Loads this object from the supplied element using super.fromXml, then loads all subjects and attributes for this subject using the supplied loader. See PSDatabaseComponent.fromDatabaseXml(org.w3c.dom.Element, com.percussion.design.objectstore.server.PSDatabaseComponentLoader, com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation) for * more information.

Specified by:
fromDatabaseXml in interface IPSDatabaseComponent
Overrides:
fromDatabaseXml in class PSDatabaseComponent
Parameters:
e - The xml element defining this component. May not be null.
cl - The database component loader. May not be null, this is may be used to load any subcomponents.
relationContext - The current relation context, may be null if no relationship exists.
Throws:
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if this component or one of it's sub-components fails to initialize with a supplied element.
PSDatabaseComponentException - if any othererror occurs loading this component from the database

for the interface definition.

getSubjects

public PSDatabaseComponentCollection getSubjects()
Get the role subjects. Any changes to this collection affect the collection in the role.

Returns:
the subjects of this role, never null, may be empty, the contents of the collection are of type PSRelativeSubject.

compareTo

public int compareTo(Object o)
Compares this PSRole to another Object, fulfilling the Comparable contract. If the Object isa PSRole, this method behaves like compareTo(PSRole). Otherwise, a ClassCastException is thrown.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable
Parameters:
o - the Object to be compared. Cannot be null
Returns:
0 if the argument is a PSRole with the same name as this PSRole; a value less than 0 if the argument is "greater than" this PSRole; and a value greater than 0 if the argument is "less than" this PSRole
Throws:
ClassCastException - - if the argument is not a PSRole.

compareTo

public int compareTo(PSRole testRole)
Compares this PSRole to another PSRole. The ordering is determined by a String comparison of the PSRoles' names.

Parameters:
testRole - the PSRoles to be compared. Cannot be null
Returns:
0 if the argument has the same name as this PSRole; a value less than 0 if the argument is "greater than" this PSRole; and a value greater than 0 if the argument is "less than" this PSRole

toXml

public Element toXml(Document doc)
This method is called to create a PSXRole XML element node containing the data described in this object.

The structure of the XML document is: 


    <!--
       PSXRole provides a way to group users within E2. Roles can be
       used within ACLs to grant a specific type of access to all
       members of the role.

       Object References:

       PSXSubject - roles are named collections containing PSXSubject
       objects.
    -->
    <!ELEMENT PSXRole (PSXRelativeSubject*, PSXAttributeList?)>
    <!ATTLIST PSXRole
       id CDATA #REQUIRED
       DbComponentId CDATA #REQUIRED
       componentState CDATA #REQUIRED
       name CDATA #REQUIRED
    >

    <!--
       The name of the role must be unique.
       It is limited to 50 characters.
    -->

Specified by:
toXml in interface IPSComponent
Returns:
the newly created PSXRole XML element node

parentDoc - may be null.
parentComponents - a collection of all the components created in the process of creating this component. May be null.
Throws:
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if the XML element node is not of type PSXRole

getAttributes

public PSAttributeList getAttributes()
Get the attribute map for this role. Any modifications to this map will affect the internal attributes of this role. The map will contain entries keyed by the attribute name with the associated value being the value of the attribute.

Returns:
The attribute list, never null.

validate

public void validate(com.percussion.design.objectstore.IPSValidationContext cxt)
              throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSValidationException
Validates this object within the given validation context. The method signature declares that it throws PSValidationException, but the implementation must not directly throw any exceptions. Instead, it should register any errors with the validation context, which will decide whether to throw the exception (in which case the implementation of validate should not catch it unless it is to be rethrown).

Specified by:
validate in interface IPSComponent
Overrides:
validate in class PSDatabaseComponent
Parameters:
cxt - The validation context.
Throws:
PSValidationException - According to the implementation of the validation context (on warnings and/or errors).
